M3v7U9aP6i_WkRnJr9Z0Eg.text: Food was great. Warm place with lots of seating and elegant interior decorations. Bathrooms very clean.

XCfOYEspQAAyQbcuH3Zy4w.text: Generous serving sizes. Our dishes arrived promptly and piping hot, which was fabulous on a winter's day. Food was very tasty, service was good and the ambiance was great.

LNWiQjpjzryRkOzu75DaTQ.text: To celebrate our work mates last day we had to treat her to lunch. Not because we were happy to see her go of course... But because she is going travelling and we're all horribly jealous!A colleague recommended this place for a quick bite to eat and a natter, so we wandered along. 12.30, 8 people table with no reservation is a good start. Also, their 2 course reduced lunch menu for £9 was a steal. So far so good, right?!Nice decor, with interesting paintings of Middle Eastern clothed people over the walls and those cute light decorations made the atmoshpere in here very welcoming. No incense though, I half expected a rich, fragrant, heady aroma from this place.We sat on ornately decorated chairs (that felt like they were made for primary school children... they were low down! And not in a Flo Rida kind of way). I ordered hummous to start (expected) and chicken kebab with salad for main, others in our party had lamb with a red lentil soup to start. All very tasty, although they tried to serve me the soup twice which was a touch annoying. Hummous could have done with more accompanying bread, I hate having leftovers. Chicken was nicely fragranced but could have done with a marinade to hold the dish together. Service was a bit lazy if I'm honest, the waiter did not really know what was going on and took AGES to let us pay, not great when you're all doing the 'looking at your watches cos you've overrun your lunch break' dance.But a fond farewell to a fabulous colleague

zzlMckvq1IAhi4OJUIUBEA.text: While the interior is a little spartan and the chairs are VERY short, the food is inexpensive and delicious.The staff are VERY friendly and accommodating.If I was a local, I'd be a repeat customer.

EQcMuJvIssEsXkzvIGW32w.text: As I'm just back from Turkey and missing being away, I thought I'd try Troia who have their own theme of Mediterranean cuisine. I had the traditional Turkish meze and boy, it was fab. Great service, quaint style of decor and furniture but never the less well worth my visit, ***** being a regular visitor to Turkey I was a little apprehensive to try Turkish in London but some of the staff are Turkish and that added to the idea of being in Turkey and the food was great!

Y-1IOHlVFr4Lb6fztHvb-A.text: The food was not much to write about. It is rare that I leave as much food as I did and send it back!The service was also disappointing, the table next to us had ordered the calamari and by the time the other diners in the part were done with their meal is when the appetizer came over.  I had to ask for the bread and olives. A table that came after us got theirs first.  Very disorganized!!The waitress asked me if I ever had Turkish food before and when I replied I had it in Istanbul, she asked where in Turkey?!?  I gather there was a lot lost in translation.

zfmMSooQcZhD-d7An7ElbQ.text: Probably the best place to dine on County Hall. Friendly service by Laziz, and great food. It's been 3 days since our arrival, and finally Troia!

8KlROIE9fwoWQRU7N-YWlg.text: Been to Troia last evening and really enjoyed the great tasting mediterranean food. We regularly go to some mediterranean restaurants in the New York/New Jersey area of USA, however, this place is better than all other places we have been to, so far, for mediterranean food. They atually have more vegeterian option than all other mediterranean restaurants we have been to. Borek was definitely appetizing. My husband ordered adana kebab and I ordered veg dish moussaka. The food felt refreshing and delicious. I ordered hot chocolate which was okay as it was made from cocoa powder unlike real chocolate which we like, while my husband loved the liquior coffee he ordered. For a perfect finish, baklava was our choice and we must confess, it was indeed the best baklava we have ever had. Would definitely come here again. I am sure if Troia would be in New York/New Jersey, we would be their regular customers.

DLxR_PmvZ7sdbeYiKVhcHg.text: Okey restaurant. The vegetarian lasagna was really good but the beef in the hamburger was one of those you buy frozen and just warm up and the fries where not that good either. We had a hard time finding a Waiter who would take our order, they just sort of looked at us and walked past. Good lunch offers though with appetizer and meal for 10£

M0EQV7JYWjIgX-H3m79jOg.text: Another local from my uni days (yes I know, I still live in the past!). This place has great authentic decor and very friendly customer service (it helps when you're in there every week...). The food is great. Being the man that I am, I always go for the mixed grill, which is a decent portion, and along with the free bread and olives they give, is definitely enough to fill you up. Good for group gatherings (advanced booking required as it is a small restaurant) and a great place to take the mrs too (or mister...). The price is just about right, nothing overly pricey on the menu.So if you want somewhere with good atmosphere, great service, good food at a reasonable price, then this is the place to go if your in the area.Oh, they do shisha too!

BSEbOnh9VrR6lP8u4XFrAQ.text: Disclaimer: This rating is a relative rating -- that is, it's being rated relative to the other eateries specific to LONDON. In short: This would be a 1 star restaurant in Chicago or NYC, a 2-star in LA, a 3-star in Orange County, or THE-BEST-FOOD-WE-ATE in London.Now all that aside, the food really was pretty good here. It was indeed the best food we had in London. I'd say it tied the restaurant at the Sanderson hotel (the fancy fusion one), except that restaurant was about 100x more expensive (and this wasn't exactly mcdonalds).We had a big tapas style ordering of about 20 or 30 different dishes so we got to try a lot of different things. Highly recommended.And as a whole, highly recommended in London, unless you particularly enjoy mushy peas.

ATBPwOielOi16mFGht4spg.text: Fantastic food. Was near Waterloo for a meeting and someone suggested Troia. The İskender kebap plate was amazing (much fancier than the traditional sort). As an American, paying 13 quid was a bit of a shock (a similar plate is about half that in the States and half that again in Turkey) but this is London... and truth be told... I would gladly pay the US$20 to have this again if given the chance.

DoLLEa0Ykov1THkc-IbTNw.text: We came here for dinner when meeting a friend at Waterloo.  It seemed a bit more like a tourist/party place, but that may be par for the course for the neighborhood.Food was ok but not outstanding.  We had much better Turkish elsewhere in London the previous day.  Quite reasonably priced.  Service was highly disorganized and *slow*.  After spending about 5 minutes trying to attract staff attention, we got up to ask for our check.  We saw other parties having similar difficulties.  As a further mark of the disorganization, the check contained two errors--we were double-charged for one main and had one drink missing.

gBlM8s947CUlNd8w4E5JlQ.text: On the outside, the restaurant does not seem to reflect that it holds inside - it appeared to be cheaply done and suitable for large groups at night. To be very honest, I would have likely to have walked past it should I not have read these reviews.However, going in it was completely different. We ordered the iskender kebab and a few starters to share between the 2 of us. The starters were great, really enjoyed the falafel and they are absolutely generously portioned. The staff are absolutely lovely and attentive but not over the top, so we had privacy and time to enjoy the meal also. The iskender is a really lovely take on the traditional one I had in Istanbul, really enjoyable. Will definitely go there again and try out the shisha option also.

kYv3molRTksIZ6fQf4wYlg.text: Troia is great!  You know that Greek place in your hometown that is a true locals hangout because the service and good are Consistently wonderful,  Even though it isn't exactly, well... Very Greek?  Troia is the same thing. Authentic is tough in the high rent district, but it works here. Turkish wine, olives to start, spicy grilled sausage, grilled lamb. Just as comforting as your similar place in your hometown.  Great staff, friendly and willing to make off-menu suggestions.

Va-Sh3RuAhz68Hyos9z7FA.text: Excellent Turkish food and great service from this family restaurant on the southbank.  Great value set meal of loads of meze. Highly recommended.

i6bUmnVJFR6eZMO-h6qcFA.text: Hmm, I was very suspicious of this place given its proximity to our hotel.  My dinner was good though - I got shish tawook.  I thought it was kind of small, but then again I was starving b/c our schedule did not allow for regular meals, wah.  There were a lot of locals in there, which usually means a place is authentic....I'd have to go there again to judge for sure.  It wasn't very busy at 2100 hours.  It got the job done, I'll say that.

MhEF64QifmMPHT8k9xrLOw.text: I can't believe no one's reviewed this lovely little gem yet! A great find in the middle of Waterloo/County Hall/South Bank commercialism and chain restaurants. Troia is a delightful Turkish restaurant and cafe to satisying ALL tastebuds. With a HUGE selection of delicious starters (order several mezze-style and share amongst friends), perfectly-cooked main courses and sweet, fresh baklava for dessert, you cannot go wrong. Troia runs great both lunch and dinner specials, so you can eat on the cheap and still leave with a full tummy. My favorites were the goat's cheese samosas, the fried haloumi, yoghurt/mint/cucumber salad, & hummus with hunks of lamb. Mains are the traditional shish/kebab variety, but the lamb I had was so incredibly tasty & smokey (seared perfectly on the grill) that it's not like anything you'd EVER find in a cheap takeaway. The mains are simple, really, because it's the starters that star here. The baklava was yummy, if not a wee bit sickly-sweet, but everything was extremely generously portioned. Service was excellent with waiters everywhere just waiting to wait on you hand & foot. If you're willing to sit outside, they also offer a lovely shisha

bx_36E-e5Md4D04lXKRktA.text: Good venue near Waterloo. Despite passing trade restaurant would most certainly eat there again.

8bTMy6eogYSmR3FtBPvDzw.text: We have never had a bad meal here, or even a remotely less than excellent one. The food, as indicated in my opening sentence, is consistently good. The prices are very reasonable for London and extremely reasonable considering it is right across from the London Eye in the County Hall buildings. The staff are great and very friendly and if I could import the whole shebang to Houston I would be a happy camper. Oh, wait, I hate bugs, so more a happy caravan-er then?

HAAL4bpFdq5-PlBQok1x1w.text: Fast and friendly service, delicious food, and an excellent price!  Also easily accommodated my gluten free needs since many options are naturally GF (just ask for the GF menu).  We loved the Mixed Grill.  We went back again for lunch during our week-long trip.

95DUPQaXBzroHWTsFsHLRA.text: Staff was okay; not very friendly. Food wasn't that great I was far from impressed. I ate here because of all the good reviews... I'd say eat elsewhere.

4Zeq14x-gRkb04lmnvRcDg.text: Super friendly and attentive service. Decided on a feast of appetizers to end our long day of exploring London. The calamari was exquisite. Flakey non greasy batter and tender insides was the best calamari we have ever had. Their falafel was moist and served with fantastic hummus. We also chose the sautéed prawns which was a highlight and the sauce served use well along side their Nann bread. The tabbouleh was ok but not a standout amount the rest of the evening.  We had our heart set on the octopus but they had an overly busy lunch and we had to go without. All in all it was a great cafe atmosphere and eye into the London night life street side. They also have a table hooka service which was unique to use and fun to both observe and partake in the wonderful scents.

LgMRNfQhuKNAP8O4f6EizQ.text: This place is amazing! The ambiance feels so welcoming and authentic, I loved it. The food was delicious. I tried both dishes and both had loads of flavor. The appetizers were well presented and exceeded my expectations. I wish I could visit every weekend, unfortunately I live in the states but this place was a hit in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The chicken was so juicy, cooked just right.
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken  Skewer, Rice & Veggies
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Tabbouleh, Hummus & Pita

UvIzFKdQXB53dgZLSgFObg.text: I hate this place.Sure, it's a touristy area, but that doesn't mean that the restaurant and its staff can treat tourists this way.First thing when we got in: a waiter with an attitude. After my friend asked if the burger came with cheese, he looked at us like he had no idea what we asked. We didn't order any wine, and he just looked at us like we weren't worth his time while collecting the wine glasses from the table.There were four of us, so we each ordered a dish. What was completely ridiculous was the fact that the food took OVER AN HOUR for it to be ready. How hard is it to scoop up some stew that had been braising for a while, grill a burger, fry some wings, and plate some salad? We had to ask two waiters if they could check on the food. Mind you, these were two different ones from the guy who took our order. The first guy never got back to us; the second one was a lot nicer but still kept insisting that it was still cooking. If he had told us that it hadn't been cooked yet, we would have walked out. I do regret not walking out because really, it was awful.Food finally arrives, and the four of us just want to leave because we're so hungry and the food tastes mediocre so we quickly scarf it down. My wings, which come with a side salad and rice, looks sad. The best part was the rice, and that tells you a lot. Wings were flavorless, tiny, and the "salad" was undressed, old, wilted lettuce. A waiter that I flagged down insisted that this was just the color after prechopping it. Psh, yeah right. Friend's salmon stew looked discolored and unappetizing.You can definitely bet that we did not leave the discretionary service charge. What a terrible experience.I'm so surprised that this restaurant was so busy the day we went. I rarely write a one star review, but to those who happen to read this: please don't ever come here; it's a waste of time, money, and appetite.

nSzOQm7qsUBw6Mucd-t8aQ.text: Tasty food, good service, nice part of town. Nice decor. I got the bourek, which was excellent. I wish I would have gotten another order. For my main course I got the iskender, which is a mixed kabob type dish (Chicken, Lamb, and Minced Lamb) with a yogurt sauce. The meat was very good except I found a hair in my minced lamb kabob. Very unfortunate as I was planning on giving this place 4 to 5 stars.

r_YPXSzwHHGplL4LUcjMrg.text: We are in London on vacation. Friend recommended we eat here. Service was horrible. Asked the waiter for recommendations and he gave one with no details. Took our order and they brought out my daughters order of spaghetti. Now mind you I ordered a salad. They brought out our entrees 15 minutes later. Salad was delivered 15 minutes after the entrees. Two items of the entrees was brought out after we finished eating. Not once did the waiter ever come check on us. No refills of our drinks. Service was terrible.

gYD-vacLBQpalFQUnBterg.text: After watching the fireworks on the Southbank, Isabel B and I wandered in here.Buzzy vibe but not full.  Beautifully decorated on a Middle Eastern theme with some lovely, colourful and ornate lighting.  I'm assuming the chairs were intended to be authentic but they were really low. It felt odd sitting in them.We were approached twice to order and then took a long time to actually receive our orders.  Drinks came first.  I had a Turkish, dry white wine which wasn't bad.  However, the starter didn't turn up.  When the mains arrived I was given a seafood stew when I had ordered a salmon stew and it was kinda average.  But by this point I couldn't be bothered to point it out.Don't get me wrong, the staff are nice.  It's just the service is all over the place.We were then asked to move to accommodate a larger group and were offered free tea to compensate, which they ensured we took advantage of.        We had Baklava for dessert which was okay but didn't blow me away.So, pretty as the venue is and nice as the staff are, this is place is kinda meh.

qVVYyCjdaNtV7sdabYZDBg.text: For the service, this place deserves 5 stars. It was attentive, without being overbearing, and the waiters were very friendly, especially given that this is such a touristy area. The food is more like a 3.5. We just had a few mezze plates so can't give a full review, but based on what we had, that's the rating I would give. There are so many amazing Mediterranean/Turkish restaurants in London, it's hard to give it more. The falafel was amazing. The borek was pretty good. The tzatziki, baba ghanoush and vine leaves were all average. The dessert has just been described by mr as heavenly. We had the apricots. It was 4 delicious little bites, but the cream in the middle of the plate tasted like squirty from a can. I mean I like squirty from a can, but it's an unusual choice to serve in a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Apricots

ck7FR8vyjj1GjtqL4jgldA.text: Amazing food! The chicken and lamb grill are superb. The baklava was one of the best I've ever had. For a first meal in London it exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

w16MSTLIQHFzrMSUgY1-ng.text: Stopped by for lunch. Attentive service, great atmosphere, delicious food! Had the borek and calamari starters. Tasty but not quite crispy enough. Fryer temperature too low perhaps? The lamb kabab was excellent -perfectly grilled and tender! My husband enjoyed his mixed grill very much. For dessert we shared baklava which was served with a scoop of strawberry ice cream. Went very well with my fresh mint tea!! Everything was fresh and flavorful!!

4DIv3shz53hlV3NU2YBqnA.text: The restaurant was full when we enterded it. Although we reservated we got a tiny place at the toilet door. The chairs were too low, the table too high. The atmosphere was very crowded, so we left the restaurant. On our way out the waiter told us he had some other tables that came available, but we were already done with it.

8YvgGlmbknpfebGHqeDZ8g.text: Kind of expensive and kind of bland. I got the beef shish, and it was salty and dry. The mixed starters were nice though.I'm not into hooka, but my friend wanted to do it. It costs £20 per thingy, though you can have as many people as you like on each. Should last about 2 hours.Overall not bad, but not stellar. The service is nice enough, particularly for the hooka. Also they gave a free cake to a birthday boy.My only real gripe is the price, though.As a side note, this is a fantastic place to take any nice Italian girl for a date! Trust me, they'll recognize the restaurant name and give you respect. No joke.

BH0ooAnTh4nEIywX7NBs8g.text: Good quick Mediterranean lunch at Southwark. Only drawback was the constant vapor smoke drafting down the patio. Hummus was fantastic. Chicken tender and flavorful.

yv2Af5v-2ZnGej0zC_yGzw.text: I modified my review so I would not be unfair to this restaurant.  We did realy enjoy our meal and the service that we received.  The quality and flavors of the food was very enjoyable.

QKPKvu-SFCG5q4xt4klJSw.text: Very tasty food but 12.5% service charge is not fair. The food price is a bit high. The food menu contains Lebanese and Turkish foods. We tried both. They were like home made foods. The hot drinks were not as perfect as foods.

kz233WBp605CffU1bd-Lsw.text: It was a Sunday night and my friend and I wanted to grab something to eat, but did not want to venture to the other side of the river. We were staying nearby and asked the manager of our hostel what he felt would be a good place to go that would still be open, and a place that would not be too expensive.He asked us if we liked Turkish/Greek food. We said yes. He told us to walk a few blocks over to Troia.We arrived a little before closing but they were still willing to serve us. We sat outside on a breezy summer night.We decided to have the mixed Meze which came with 7 little plates(pretty much like tapas) Everything was delicious, especially the Hummus. The waiter even brought us more bread when we finished our first basket. My friend is half Arab and knows her food and she told me she would describe the food more along the lines of Lebanese than Greek or Turkish.Though they were closing in 10 minutes they asked us if we wanted any dessert or coffee(most places tend to rush a person when they are ready to close, but they were still eager to serve). Since we realised they were closing we didn't want to put them through any trouble, but they assured us it was okay, so  we ordered two coffees.Instead of our waiter bringing out the coffee, the owner did. He asked us how we liked the food and where we were from. He was a very nice guy. It means a lot when the owner takes interest in what his customers think. He told us to take our time and enjoy the coffee.When I visit London I will make it a point to visit here again. The service was above average and the food was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. I always forget to take a photo before I start eating. This was midway through the meal.

D-ZvBO5N4n6sgpDm8IHieA.text: Great reccomendation by my fellow Yelpers!  This was right across from our hotel and, at first, I was a little sceptical.  Ultimately, I am very glad we gave it a go.  Friendly wait staff and delicious meal.  The hamus was great and I enjoyed my entree, the mixed grill (lamb, chicken, and more lamb).  The rice and salad complemented the meats perfectly.  So glad we "found" this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

xM8AkswzZpfswD4RyjNlBA.text: Great location,close to Westminster Abbey and London Eye. Quite crowded, but the service was fast and the staff was nice and always within reach. The menu is rather simple but I think everyone will be able to find something for themselves. Has some turkish and mediterrean dishes. I took pasta with salmon and green siding salad - both were quite good and well composed although the salad had a bit too much vinegar. The place is quite stylish yet simple - good place to hang out with friends. Nothing exceptional, yet a decent default option.

-sH5AOvT1xUvAMt4-ouuQg.text: A small cafe serving good food.Not a 'restaurant' look or feel, but good value for money in a very touristy area

_Ib0tUopBeA0pCgdOsoQyA.text: Stumbled into here and it was delicious.  Super friendly staff and fantastic fresh food!  The humus kavurma is terrific and the chicken my daughter had in her salad melts in your mouth!!

Ywd72Mfii7vb4_VO3H2X8w.text: First visit to Europe, first time in London, first night here we went to Troia. We felt very comfortable (we're from US). The wait staff was super-nice and welcoming. The food was as good as any we've had in our 3 days here! Hope to go back and try some of their interesting looking coffees and desserts!

IHKNmKo52oa3EMvHHLLaNg.text: We had a Meze for 2, and everything we tasted was delicious. From the grilled pita to the tabbouleh to the hummus to the kofte and the chicken and lamb stew. Delicious.

rwEmMA93QKGpKJraj4zYQA.text: I would have given five star for the food but customer service and uncomfortable furniture is what pulled the rating down. Given the location however its a good place to eat.

U9aft4nOjPPq5gVyuoymdQ.text: The food was excellent! Service was superb!  Nice leisurely dinner not too crowded by typical tourists. Food was fantastic!!!

suHhyGSW6T_jh3hzDA3g2A.text: Service was fantastic and the hummus was delish.  (I got a 2nd order). Delicious food and quaint atmosphere with very interesting glasswork.

OfoOmgC7Rnq7qj3pi5jsmA.text: The Turkish food was excellent- but the items on the menu for tourist - fish and chips, hamburgers, etc- are not worth trying. The fish was mainly bread. Took my visiting family here before a visit to Parliament- and the reviews were very mixed. So don't try the pub food here- but try something else and avoid disappointment.

fgWrU4VLPHmt6-ZGJzae2w.text: Had the London meze meal which was tasty and more than we were able to finish. The kids liked their meals too and also had more than they could finish, really unusual! The service was good too with more bread coming before we asked. Great value.

b2_fK6SYX8qzVVdpjuzq4w.text: Great place for dinner. Food was so good. We got the fix price option and had many dishes to try. Lots of flavor and friendly staff.

Co9NW9TYYUFCTYQTZMGzKA.text: Everything fantastic. Service great and the food was fantastic.  One of the few opens open on Christmas and what a fantastic find.

ecaU8wanV_zB9wGskGK-0Q.text: Lamb casseroles were amazing. Fair prices for London. Especially being next to the London Eye area. Service was remarkable as well. We sat outside and it was very nice outside. Would definitely come here again and they had wifi

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. My fiancee loved her dish as well!
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

MOnx_nAJj8rG5B_9EavMHA.text: We ran across this wonderful restaurant after a trip to the London Eye.  It's Turkish and the food is wonderful.  The service was great and the atmosphere was friendly.  Great mixed vegetarian plates moussaka and wonderful grilled chicken. If you like Mediterranean food you will like this place

ESAiFsrktWV8iMQUVwaMtQ.text: The pasta has good flavor that we can finish it all at once or maybe we're very hungry!The fish and chips taste good but a bit oily after a few bites.Yet the service is very friendly and nice and the foods are ready soon very efficient!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Very friendly service!

NYqYhHToymPYLq968NPpXA.text: Ordered the ribeye, sadly disappointed, tough as leather and as bland a sand. I've had buffet carvery better than this.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Gristle

kmZhDfpEDvKToFzlraGy3Q.text: Food is good here. We had a few buyers and chicken kabob. Service was quick with starters coming out right away.Server was friendly.

z0Lfiywt6pQaCSumk2yDjg.text: This place has potential, it's in a great location and the decor has a lovely, Arabian feel to it, but the place is a bit lacklustre mainly because of the service. When I called to make a reservation, they didn't really seem to register what I was saying and even though they had confirmed the reservation, they didn't seem to know I had made a reservation when I got to the place. Even though the waiters were polite, most of them seemed quite ingenuine. The food came fairly quickly and it was quite nice, but nothing special, so paying £35 for two main dishes and a beer seemed quite steep for a mediocre service and standard food.

X1j7MnZ1CGw4Zxw3uAqvSQ.text: As another review stated, this place does have great decor and vibe; however, its service is extremely lacking. I went in with two friends hoping to kill some time before heading to our London Eye reservation for dinner but ended up waiting an hour for our food to still not arrive. During that time I noticed about half a dozen tables that have arrived before us still not being served. By the end of the hour we decided to just get our food for take away and come back for it after our London Eye reservation, which the waiter happily obliged to. After nearly an hour we come back to pick up our order and our food was apparently still not ready. We waited an extra 30min on top of the hour we waited initially and on top of the hour we went away to the London Eye!  The waiter felt sorry for us and gave us sodas but that still help the situation. The manager then brought out the food in plates when we asked for take away which was another annoyance. When the food was finally packed, we double checked the bag and they didn't even get our order correct-- giving us a pasta rather than the salad we ordered. Not only did we have to wait nearly three hours for our food, we had to wait three hours for the wrong food. All in all, I would not recommend this restaurant and would suggest walking a bit further from the tourist attractions to get a better dining experience.

vpFt_TWfewrNQxui0yoxig.text: I do not give out a lot of 5 stars. But for the value Troia deserves it. People should take note and try it. The food was quality from the first taste. All ingredients were fresh and the dishes home made including the dessert we had. Our starters were the feta and peppers and the Hummus. Both were extremely tasty. The feta was smooth and creamy and the rocket salad it was over was very fresh. I had the Iskander platter which was the mixed grill kabob (lamb,chicken and ground lamb) with the bread and yoghurt. Flavors were amazing. My wife had the chicken shish kabob. Very moist and tender with good flavor. The dessert was a home made baklava. The nuts was finely chopped and it was just sweet enough. It was paired with vanilla Movenpick ice cream.  Large enough to split. All this for 58£ with the service. Really awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Iskender dish. Mixed grill kabob of lamb, chicken and ground lamb with yoghurt

3w4AgD5KjkwEi7_08qchrQ.text: Ok. Far from great, especially considering the 20% service charge they tack on to your bill after subpar service and mediocre food. I would not recommend this place for anything other than a hookah bar.

u37GQ7csty7PzB2qU7nmSw.text: Horrible service. Waiters have no patience and we saw them serve tables the wrong food or completely forget about people for 30 minutes. Food wasn't worth the poor experience.

Od3h0jWRN39qk9ivKQ1OJQ.text: Great place for families. The bread and hummus were fantastic to start the meal off. The calamari was yummy and the pasta was also good.  Not a long wait with excellent service

Hc8lLRzwIV4l6emfAzIHXA.text: On a recent trip to London, I made it my mission to eat a different nationality food each and every day.  This might very well have been the best of the bunch!  Came with a colleague who didn't mind taking this food adventure with me.  We actually ended up here on accident as we were looking for a sushi place, but I guess it went out of business.  This looked inviting and you can't go wrong with Turkish/Mediterranean food, so we stopped in.There's some 13 course meal deal for 12 pounds (or 12 courses for 14 pounds) each that looked like a great way to try a little bit of everything.  The two of us split a Turkish bottle of wine and gorged ourselves on the plentiful food we were served.Hospitable staff (although we didn't really talk much to them) and AMAZING food.  Bringing the wife back to London on my next trip, and I'm sure we'll hit this place up!

8xSOZktxjt3o7mkeDHuZdg.text: Excellent find right outside the London Eye area. Delicious Turkish food at very reasonable prices. the service is somewhat relaxed and slow but otherwise expected good flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Delicious halumi avocado salad
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shank is excellent and huge!
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken shish kebob

ImZk1KCtZ4hQOLjk2mvhUg.text: Tried the lamb shank and mixed grill. Both were fantastic. 5 star food. The lamb shank was probably the best I've ever had. Very good ambiance. The presentation of the food was on point. Definitely try the chilly sauce, it's very good..

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

YgfXkSERQaTr2tiG2Y_J9Q.text: Great place with very good service.  Lively and great portions for the money. The server was very polite accommodating and the suggestions he gave were bang on. Not often you leave things on your plate in London but this place gave you a great taste of food from Turkey.  Not a great selection of restaurants in that area so this one was a gem for sure

CoQr3eXgHq60vfBXalOP5g.text: The bathrooms were so disgusting I almost was sick to my stomach. If they allow that in the PUBLIC area, I can only imagine what they allow in the PRIVATE areas.

X75DffIqQnwt7Mt7tgTQUw.text: Food was decent-- however, the bathroom was absolutely awful. There was one unisex stall for the entire restaurant. There were bodily fluids spilled all over the room, and no soap. If that's how the bathroom looked, I'm afraid to think of what the kitchen looks like.

8_oWamAisQ8IxYjiiK6iIw.text: The staff are friendly and the menu is mainly Turkish ,the restaurant is decorated to make you feel that you are sitting somewhere in Turkey but does lack atmosphere .We tried the lamb moussaka and the spicy beef stew which arrived very quickly both were tasty but nothing special . Overall it was pleasant experience but it did not leave me thinking that I wanted to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lamb moussaka
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Spicy beef stew
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

sWwmBGFmFjICOrvZFhycBw.text: We found this great little restaurant in London that has exceptional food specially fish and chips! You need to try this place

02FvfJCvXRkHfZSgYtNMYw.text: Very good Mediterranean food. But I wish there had been more salt and lemon in the humus. The mixed grill was delicious but make sure and ask for some chili sauce as that took the dish from a 3 to a 4. The  chicken salads where good and the burger as well. We had intended to ride the Londoneye but after learning that a ride for the five of us would cost nearly $200 American dollars we opted for a leisurely dinner instead. Good find amongst the myriad of bland food English restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Calamari... perfect!
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Hummus... yummy and creamy!
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken salad.

QHYBPzuCFQCcosIgWn4srw.text: Food was very delicious and authentic. Great service and outdoor seating. I will be back again before we leave London.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Hummus
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burger

SOuOZmgqV7eVnGG1EKW44w.text: We had the mezze plate. It was incredible and there was more than enough for two people. We will definitely return when we are back in London.

ZDlnuQ96-BmMC8ij6DFxpA.text: I got the lamb kebabs, and they were very well cooked. Just a touch too well done for my personal preference, but flavor was fantastic. And I'm sure they would've cooked to my liking had I asked/had they asked me. Price is moderate. The one negative was the bathrooms were absolutely disgusting. I had to swallow my pride, momentarily forget my (borderline) germophobic tendencies, and actually clean off the toilet (to use). I was scared to touch the floor, as it was wet just about everywhere. If you don't have to go while you're there, you'll have a solid time.

C4Y1HOej8BCvfEJuTUoTgw.text: Conveniently located near our hotel. TZatiki was delicious. It was a lot of tzatiki, but not enough bread to go with it, in my opinion. Chicken kebabs were nicely flavoured and very tender and juicy. Staff at the restaurant is okay, could have given off a friendlier vibe. Their fish & chips looked delicious! If I go back before I leave town, I'd like to try their fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Tzatiki, pita bread, and chicken kebabs

jqT-bTDqm09IEcOvLv1llA.text: What a great place to stop and have lunch after visiting the London eye. We're trying to avoid the rain so we stopped in and had some hummus and pasta and wine. I know those don't sound like they go together but it was actually quite scrumptious. The location is fantastic, right down by the river.I highly recommend this place to anyone who needs a quick pitstop in between tourist attractions.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Greek salad
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

AU6r7soI78Ai5Ni2S4uhnw.text: My husband and I are on Day 1 of our 14 day honeymoon and this place in London was wonderful. It was walking distance to where we're staying and in a nice plaza close to other restaurants which put me at ease for night time walking. The menu is very affordable all the while tasting excellent and you can even order hookah which I thought was nice. We dined indoors but they have an outdoor dining area as well. The inside was decorated with Turkish style lamps and their bar area looked neat and tidy. Service was great and their Turkish wine was nice and smooth too. We would definitely come back here. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Brie cheese with strawberry sauce and arugula :D
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Interior is great. The lamps are beautiful.

0-Udzarx9cQr4yLJDKp9yQ.text: Excellent service and superb food! Sat on the patio and enjoyed perfect meal in an unhurried alfresco atmosphere.

WCWWGtwIv1kfPQLX1MfCow.text: Troia is located across from the Park Plaza Westminister Hotel.  This was our first, but not our last visit.  David, our waiter for the evening gave great advice and was kind and helpful. We had lamb and chicken kebabs with rice and salad.  I barely needed a knife to cut through the melt in your mouth lamb.  The chicken was juicy.  Nice wine list and good single glasses.  Very generous portions.  Nice mix of couples and families.Don't miss out!!!!!!!  It was wonderful.

gH1gzyz0lzWb3SHAM_fctg.text: The English aren't know for food but this place is an exception. When in London make sure to visit this place. The food is good the service is good and it is reasonably priced. A must visit!

oZD8IXedkrkExJtRU9dRpw.text: Great little place! Food and service is excellent! Everything was fresh and cooked with skill. If you are a foodie...this place is a pleasant experience.

e6W3TDgsGMMLyxzN_srbmQ.text: We weren't expecting much in a tourist area, but I have to mention that the food was pretty tasty. I had the chicken kebab and they were very good. When I ate here, it happened to be my birthday and I met and spoke with the manager--who is simply an amazing man. As per usual, I got a complimentary birthday cake which was a very sweet gesture from the manager. We constantly complimented the servers on the food, and even asked for more of a spicy sauce that they had--and our service was very good and the staff treated us extremely well. The ambiance was a little casual romance whilst being dimly lit. It was very family friendly and my party liked it a lot. Having driven around Europe to many restaurants and even rest stops on the road, I have just accepted that most public bathrooms in Europe are weird. Europe is a very old place with a long history. Should they update their bathrooms? Surely. But they probably won't, so I'm not holding my breath.

bEiKXjtYzyvV1x8gP7yYUQ.text: We had a very nice lamb kabobs and Mediterranean grilled chicken, nicely prepared.  Wish I had some starters - a chance at Tzaziki or the grilled octopus were some of the Hong's that drew us in after a long day visiting the English countryside. I would warn you off the lemon water - both my wife and I suffered greatly from it's lasting effects into the night. Service was good and the decor created a Mediterranean ambiance that added to the dining experience. Perhaps worth another try, but with so many fine dining choices, not soon.

NFiskoMTKgLjPpASPS0xRw.text: The food was just ok and the service was meh. Kind of rude. Pros // seating suitable for large parties, diverse menu Atmosphere // love the hanging lamps they were beautiful, music was niceService // rude, but I felt like he tried harder towards the end. I have never had any waiter tell me not to get something and work so hard to get me to order something else.....even though I said I wanted to try it (I'm the one Paying for it...) absolutely terrible service. If your yogurt beverage is that nasty, take it off your menu...Food // got the mixed grill plate. Comes with lamb, Kabab, and chicken. The chicken was a bit dry, and the lamb kabab was a bit salty. Overall just ok for me. They gave some nice spicy sauce which actually isn't spicy but had a nice unique flavor. Overall // wouldn't come back

hqxO-oSNwckmdXSsH95DAw.text: Service guy asked if we want drinks then ignored us for 20 min we had to stop another server n ask him to be our waiter.. other than that the price, presentation,  taste n ambiance/ decor made me give it 4 stars

cis3XUCiR-EUGCRymMnuhg.text: Despite being in the heart of a tourist zone across from a hotel, this was NOT a tourist trap. I was rubbing my eyes when I saw the four star overall on Yelp considering the location. Seriously all of the other places in the same area ranged from 2-3.5 stars. Service was friendly and fairly attentive. It was Father's Day and the waiter was quick to wish me good tidings. I'm fairly sure it was the owner who also came by later to say hello and ask if we were enjoying our meal which we did.The food is really tasty. Portions could be a little larger for the price but definitely well prepared. I got the lamb skewers which were excellent. Good seasoning and juicy. One daughter had the chicken skewers and same deal. Both come with a simple salad and basmati rice. My other daughter ate a burger which was standard. My wife ordered the seafood stew which came with prawns and squid (she opted out of mussels) vegetables in a creamy tomato sauce which worked wonders with the rice. We also got calamari which was yummy but again would have loved just a bit more on the plate. The bread they served was phenomenal. If you're looking for a good bite in this area Troia is worth the check-in.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Seafood stew
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken skewers
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Burger

gPsgztZATLQnxk2Tsw77Cw.text: A three minute walk from the London Eye, this place has great Mediterranean food. Started with the tzatziki and truth be told I wanted to lick the plate- it was so creamy and delicious, and served with warm, grilled pita. They even brought us over extra pita (thank you!) I ordered the lamb moussaka and my boyfriend ordered the adana kebab, both of which we enjoyed very much. We ended our night with hookah outside. The owner came out and chatted with us and gave us flavor suggestions. The service here is on point- they checked in on us frequently without being overbearing. We were the last table of the night as they were closing up and they encouraged us to stay and enjoy the last of our hookah without feeling rushed. An awesome experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Tzatziki- SO good!!
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lamb moussaka
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Adana kebab

e8-8yrAEl_cL_9nBvnXq6A.text: The service was really slow, it was busy though. We never got drink refills or our bread refilled before we had to leave. Aside from that, the food was SO GOOD! We split the Meza for 2. It included a bunch of stuff, all vegetarian. It had hummus, grape leaves, falafel, tabouleh, and s few other dishes. They have a kids menu and my daughter ended up getting the pomodoro pasta. We were hungry and it was quick and easy to get in and eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

rofY8MXml5VODU2I4_CzrA.text: Sat outside with good weather. Service was a little slow compared to the fast pace American style we are used to. Food was good. Yogurt sauce was more on the minty side but still tasty. We both had lamb kebabs with rice and salad. The salad dressing was light, fruity, and tasty! If I were in the area again I would probably come back. So much food to explore in London but this was definitely a good stop!

pDGsga2bG98bq1SvqgKpNQ.text: This restaurant was near our hotel and the London Eye, so I wasn't expecting much. Surprise! The lamb kabob was outstanding! So delicious and melt in your mouth tender. The fresh mint tea was a perfect way to end my meal

YO9D00xkasac3aed0ChVhw.text: Great Mediterranean food and George, our Greek waiter, was lovely. We had a variety of appetizers and they were all yummy. I had a spicy shrimp dish that was hardy and flavorful and warming!! Took all my leftovers home too and it was just as good the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Mix of appetizers
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Falafel apps

jT7i5XNfYwmOGtZuFtjEvg.text: This place was a nice stop just behind the building facing the London Eye. The food was good and the staff were nice. They are a little stingy with the serving of humus.

5xHA4rMaEhzsQuDSi_wb3g.text: We got the baba ganoush as a starter.  My daughter thought it was the best she's ever had.  They mixed something besides the roasted eggplant and garlic.  Maybe sour cream or cream cheese?  I thought it was ok.  The pita was not warmed thru completely so it was only okay overall.  As an entree we got the spicy prawns and chicken kofte kebab.  The prawns was good but definitely different spices.  Didn't taste very Mediterranean.  My daughter said it taste like jambalaya. I got the chicken.  Kebab was okay.  A little cold like the pita.  I'm giving it it a 3 star  because I don't think the prices merit the dishes.  I would compare it to typical pedestrian Mediterranean places.

hU5malEX9Vje9GzFdXiF6A.text: Great service, even better food, and the prices aren't that bad. Best Kebab I've ever had!

EENgYisUdJxudvrfo3UhGQ.text: First off, absolutely great food! Was surprisingly very tasty, the decor was very drab and dark which made it feel a little sketchy when ordering.The greeter at the door was really friendly but our waiter was completely "over" his job. Came up to our table and didn't introduce himself, basically gave us a look of "well what do you want."Honestly, go here have a delicious meal, don't expect anything more than great food.

XrV-qL2i8Q5Tdg38Aiu1CQ.text: Food was good.  We had the "London meal" which was a mix of small portions of a few dishes.  It was great ! Portions were great and they accommodated us in one of the dishes we didn't want and gave us more of another one instead. Location is ok.  Easy access and lots of space.  The service was slightly slow and they added 12,5% service fee to the bill without asking.  We do not appreciate this practice.  It's up to the customer to make this decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

nBwqjKrxmcFK-UgLS_2s2Q.text: Food - 5Service - 5Value - 4Great spot for lunch after taking in the tourist sites around Parliament Square (this spot is located across the river and closer to Waterloo Station than Westminster Station).  We got the Prawns as a starter and then an order of Lamb Shish Kebab and an order of the Mixed Grill.  We all agreed that while everything was fresh and tender -- what stole the show was the Lamb Shish Kebab.  Prior to this trip to Europe, my mom never really liked lamb meat.  But after Troia (and a few other places in the UK), my mom realized she really likes lamb meat after all!

kfRUXc9G3bHYrtI8ssMb-g.text: Awful experience. Came here based on the positive Yelp reviews and had a horrible experience. The menu was fine but the service was horrible. The server couldn't be bothered to explain anything on the menu and then cursed my children in Turkish (which my husband speaks and he didn't know). Completely unacceptable and disgusting.

GfrM4f4uUntwCJzwMu2XPQ.text: What a delicious treat, and fabulous service! The staff was so nice. I had Hummus, fried Brie cheese and spinach and cheese rolls as me appetizer. For my meal, I had the veggie sandwich with roasted tomatoes and halloumi cheese, with French fries. So tasty! Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

jKJFmeiUirElhmM3-6FQpA.text: Mushroom spinach chicken was flavorful and big breast of chicken. Spicy beef was very good but portion was mid sized. Food for price is great. Service slow at beginning but they were very nice to us. And our waiter and manager kept smiling. It was nice. Definitely recommend the Turkish coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lights
Photo of Troia Southbank Charcoal Kebab Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Turkish coffee. The mother freaking best

p_04qAt9T9ahW2M0e00PAg.text: Food was amazingly awesome! Me and my husband got a pasta dish and the portion was pretty generous. We were so full after eating about half the plate. The hostess is very animated and almost borderline "crazy" when trying to get customers into the door. It's very entertaining to watch. The prices are reasonable and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

vV06WfAiwDMUFheQFAcHdQ.text: The food was good but there were no mixed drinks, no full bar.  It was convenient to our location, so it was worth it but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.

5F4pLbmkobd6HTIf7JjISQ.text: Noticed this restaurant near our hotel, and then read reviews on yelp so decided to try it. We were very pleasantly surprised how good it is, especially considering its proximity to the hoards of tourists a block away at the London Eye. There were five in our party, including a teen and a pre-teen.  The kids were both happy with the burger and fries on the menu (and there is a children's menu too).  The adults shared the Troia mixed grill, the chicken casserole, the carrot salad, and the tomato and avocado salad. Everything was delicious. The salads were about twice as large as we expected for a side salad, and very fresh with perfectly ripe avocados and a light tasty dressing. The lamb on the mixed grill was tender and well seasoned. The chicken casserole had a wonderful flavor too and we were offered a red chili paste to heat it up a bit.  The service was great - we only had 30 minutes to eat because we were trying to make a show, and the server helped us order dishes that could be prepared quickly and then made sure they got to the table fast. This restaurant is really more of a modest 4 star, but I added another star because of the unexpectedly delicious food and the helpful service.

x8PIDbbo4pp0BGTF-D4jbw.text: It may not look like but this is probably the best turkish/Kurdish restaurant you can find in London. Try the lamb with pears and don't leave before you drunk a glass Raki. You can also smoke Shisha at the terasse (for a very reasonable price).
